meanings.definition: To search or scout for something.
meanings.sent1: I will scouth the park for my lost toy.
meanings.sent2: The detective decided to scouth the area for clues.
meanings.sent3: As I scouthed the house for my keys, I realized they were in my pocket all along.
meanings.sent4: She scouthed the library shelves for the perfect book to read.
meanings.sent5: The explorer scouthed the jungle, looking for rare plants.

meanings.sent1: The rabbit will scouth across the field to escape the fox.
meanings.sent2: The wind made the leaves scouth along the ground.
meanings.sent3: The cheetah can scouth faster than any other animal.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to scouth by as we enjoyed ourselves at the party.
meanings.sent5: The car scouthed down the highway, reaching top speed.

meanings.definition: A young person involved in scouting activities.
meanings.sent1: My sister is a scouth in the local scout group.
meanings.sent2: The scouth helped the elderly lady cross the street.
meanings.sent3: The little scouth proudly showed off his merit badges.
meanings.sent4: The scouths gathered around the campfire for stories.
meanings.sent5: The scouths went on a hike to earn their nature badges.
